title: Veronica Inglese
text:
Veronica Inglese (born 22 November 1990) is an Italian <a href="long-distance%20running">long-distance runner</a>. She won a silver medal at the <a href="2016%20European%20Athletics%20Championships">2016 European Athletics Championships</a>.
Biography.
In the 5,000m, she won the bronze medal at the <a href="2009%20European%20Junior%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">2009 European Junior Championships in Athletics</a>. She won twelve <a href="Italian%20Athletics%20Championships">Italian national</a> titles, including four senior (5000m, 10 km road, cross-country and 10,000m track). She has been selected several times on the <a href="Italy%20national%20athletics%20team">national</a> team: at the 2011 World Championships, at the <a href="2013%20European%20Cross%20Country%20Championships">2013 European Cross Country Championships</a> where she finished 8th, and at the <a href="2014%20Half%20Marathon%20World%20Championships">2014 Half Marathon World Championships</a>, among others.
On 1 May 2016, she ran in Palo Alto the 10,000m in 31:42:02, which qualifies her for the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">Rio Olympics</a>, a time she adds over 5,000m, 15:22:45, 25 June 2016 in Rieti to win the national championship. On 6 July 2016, she finished 6th in the 10,000m European Championships in Amsterdam, beating her personal best, and on 10 July she won the half marathon silver medal behind <a href="Sara%20Moreira">Sara Moreira</a>.
National titles.
She won four national championships at individual senior level in four different specialities.
